00062 
00063   // Search through the currently-allocated windows, looking for
00064   // one that would be compatible.
00065   for(int i = 0; i < MAX_VME_HANDLES; i++) {
00066     if(vme_handles[i].used &&
00067        vme_handles[i].mapping.address_space == mapping.address_space &&
00068        vme_handles[i].mapping.supuseram == mapping.supuseram &&

00073         MIN(vme_addr, vme_handles[i].vme_base);

00077 
00078       if(new_vme_size <= MAX_VME_MAPPED_SIZE) {
00079         handle = &vme_handles[i];
00080         break;
00081       }
00082     }
00083   }
00084 
00085   // If we didn't find one, then look for a brand-new window
00086   if(handle == NULL) {
00087     new_vme_base = vme_addr;
00088     new_vme_size = vme_addr_end - vme_addr;
00089 
00090     for(int i = 0; i < MAX_VME_HANDLES; i++) {
00091       if(!(vme_handles[i].used)) {
00092         handle = &vme_handles[i];
00093       }
00094     }
00095   }
00096 
00097   // If the window is brand-new, then open a file descriptor for it.
00098   if(!handle->used) {
00099 
00100     // Try each of the device special files
00101     for(int i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
00102       char filename[20];
00103       sprintf(filename, "/dev/vme_a32_%d", i);
00104       handle->fd = open(filename, O_RDWR);
00105       if(handle->fd >= 0) {
00106         break;
00107       }
00108     }
00109 
00110     // Check that we found one
00111     if(handle->fd < 0) {
00112       diag_print(0, "Unable to open a VME device file\n");
00113       return NULL;
00114     }
00115   }
00116   // Otherwise, unmap the associated memory 
00117   else {
00118     munmap((void *) handle->base, handle->size);
00119   }
00120 
00121   // Set the address space mapping
00122   if(ioctl(handle->fd, VMEIMG_SETMAPPING, &mapping)) {
00123     perror("ioctl VMEIMG_SETMAPPING");
00124     return NULL;
00125   }
00126 
00127   // Set the VME base address appropriately
00128   if(ioctl(handle->fd, VMEIMG_SETVMEADDR, new_vme_base)) {
00129     perror("ioctl VMEIMG_SETVMEADDR");
00130     return NULL;
00131   }
00132 
00133   // Retrieve the base address that the driver actually accepted
00134   if(ioctl(handle->fd, VMEIMG_GETVMEADDR, &handle->vme_base)) {
00135     perror("ioctl VMEIMG_GETVMEADDR");
00136     return NULL;
00137   }
00138 
00139   // Map some memory for the region of interest
00140   handle->base = (volatile unsigned char *) 
00141     mmap(NULL, new_vme_size, PROT_WRITE | PROT_READ, MAP_SHARED, handle->fd, 0);
00142   if(handle->base == (volatile unsigned char *) -1) {
00143     perror("mmap VME address space");
00144     return NULL;
00145   }
00146

00148   handle->used = true;

00150   handle->mapping.address_space = mapping.address_space;
00151   handle->mapping.supuseram = mapping.supuseram;
00152   handle->mapping.prgdataam = mapping.prgdataam;
00153   handle->fifo_block_size = fifo_block_size;
